newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Zalakeramia buys stake in Romanian firm.
newsitem.headline: Zalakeramia buys stake in Romanian firm.

text.p: Hungary's tile manufacturer Zalakeramia Rt on Tuesday announced it had signed an agreement with the Romanian State Ownership Fund to acquire the Fund's 62 percent stake in S.C. Cesarom S.A., one of Romania's leading tile and sanitary ware.
Zalakeramia made the acquisition via Hussar Holding AG, its wholly-owned subsidiary, on May 30, it said in a statement, without revealing financial details.
"Cesarom's joining the Zalakeramia group provides us with a significant new producing capacity, high quality products and access to one of central Europe's largest markets," Zalakeramia said.
The Cesarom deal was Zalakeramia's third acquisition this year, as it had bought majority stakes in Croatia's Inker and in Hungary's Pietra earlier this year.
